message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.SD. 

The paper is about training speech recognition systems under limited or no supervision, which falls under the field of natural language processing (NLP) and specifically, automatic speech recognition (ASR). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. 

The paper also involves segmentation of audio using voice activity detection, which falls under the field of signal processing, making cs.SD (Sound) another likely sub-category. 

The paper also involves evaluation metrics and baseline systems, which could fall under the fields of machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). 

Finally, the paper involves using limited textual resources and unaligned text, which could fall under the field of unsupervised learning (cs.SI).
